referents.fragment: Never wanna have it my way

range.content: Never wanna have it my way

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html:
This line may allude to suicidal thoughts, which MGK discusses in his first and third verses. He also mentions having such thoughts on the later Hotel Diablo tracks “Death in My Pocket,” which also features vocals from Naomi Wild, and “I Think I’m OKAY.”

Even though MGK references suicide and death in general throughout Hotel Diablo, he also expresses a desire to fall back in love with life, which would be impossible had he died of suicide — for example, on “Death in My Pocket,” he describes his contradicting mindset:

I’ve got death in my pocket
But I feel so alive

Aside from his career, a key reason MGK is hesitant towards acting on such thoughts is his daughter, Casie, who he references later in the song, as well as on songs like “Floor 13.” Loved ones and family are often cited as a protective factor against suicide. “Death in My Pocket” also discusses his desire to stay alive for Casie:

Hope I’m alive to see my baby get her cap and gown

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html:
MGK’s daughter, Casie Colson Baker, was born when the rapper was only 18 years old. He also mentions her on “FLOOR 13” and “Hollywood Whore.”

MGK told Cleveland:

I added that verse months after everyone first heard the song. I think everyone thought [it was too revealing]. That was an uncomfortable moment for sure.
body.plain:
MGK’s daughter, Casie Colson Baker, was born when the rapper was only 18 years old. He also mentions her on “FLOOR 13” and “Hollywood Whore.”

MGK told Cleveland:

I added that verse months after everyone first heard the song. I think everyone thought [it was too revealing]. That was an uncomfortable moment for sure.

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html:
“The sun” seems to refer to a better mental state — MGK touches upon depression throughout Hotel Diablo, perhaps most notably on “Death in My Pocket” and “I Think I’m OKAY.” He describes it similarly on “Hollywood Whore”:

It’s no sun, the clouds are opaque

On a more literal level, insomnia and depression commonly co-occur. MGK went on to describe sleep issues on “5:3666”:

I’m writing this at 5:3666 in the morning
Wide awake still, not even yawning
Not even sure why I’m up at dawn like I’m celebrating
body.plain:

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html:
MGK started smoking cigarettes to cope with stress in his life. He announced this habit on 2018’s “LATELY”:

Life’s been getting to me, I just started smoking squares (I’m stressed)
But they ain’t getting in my circle though, we still prepared (For real)
body.plain:
MGK started smoking cigarettes to cope with stress in his life. He announced this habit on 2018’s “LATELY”:

Life’s been getting to me, I just started smoking squares (I’m stressed)
But they ain’t getting in my circle though, we still prepared (For real)

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html:
Lil Peep was a rapper known for helping pioneer an emo revival style of hip-hop. He passed away on November 15, 2017, after an accidental drug overdose.

Peep and MGK met at a fashion show in July 2017. MGK expressed his regret about not getting to have a proper conversation at a concert:

A few months after this song’s release, MGK paid tribute to Peep with a short cover of his track “walk away as the door slams.”
body.plain:
Lil Peep was a rapper known for helping pioneer an emo revival style of hip-hop. He passed away on November 15, 2017, after an accidental drug overdose.

Peep and MGK met at a fashion show in July 2017. MGK expressed his regret about not getting to have a proper conversation at a concert:

https://twitter.com/blacksheephippy/status/1026177942907310082

A few months after this song’s release, MGK paid tribute to Peep with a short cover of his track “walk away as the door slams.”

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html: Mac Miller was a rapper, songwriter, and record producer from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, who died of an apparent drug overdose in September 2018. MGK told Complex after Miller’s death that they recorded a song together, but it never came out.
body.plain: Mac Miller was a rapper, songwriter, and record producer from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, who died of an apparent drug overdose in September 2018. MGK told Complex after Miller’s death that they recorded a song together, but it never came out.

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html:
Chester Bennington was the lead singer of Linkin Park who died by suicide in July 2017. A month before Bennington’s death, MGK performed with Linkin Park in Poland, and he was set to be a special guest on the U.S. leg of their tour, which was ultimately cancelled.

Following Bennington’s death, Linkin Park held a show called Linkin Park and Friends: Celebrate Life in Honor of Chester Bennington, and MGK joined the group to perform their 2001 song “Papercut.” He also paid tribute to Bennington by sampling LP’s “Numb” on previous Hotel Diablo track “Hollywood Whore”.
body.plain:
Chester Bennington was the lead singer of Linkin Park who died by suicide in July 2017. A month before Bennington’s death, MGK performed with Linkin Park in Poland, and he was set to be a special guest on the U.S. leg of their tour, which was ultimately cancelled.

Following Bennington’s death, Linkin Park held a show called Linkin Park and Friends: Celebrate Life in Honor of Chester Bennington, and MGK joined the group to perform their 2001 song “Papercut.” He also paid tribute to Bennington by sampling LP’s “Numb” on previous Hotel Diablo track “Hollywood Whore”.

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html:
MGK’s friend Pete Davidson is a comedian, actor, and Saturday Night Live cast member who lives with borderline personality disorder and suicidal thoughts — he shared with Self:

I’ve spoken about BPD and being suicidal publicly only in the hopes that it will help bring awareness and help kids like myself who don’t want to be on this earth.

Davidson later appears on “A Message From the Count,” a playful interlude on Hotel Diablo.
body.plain:
MGK’s friend Pete Davidson is a comedian, actor, and Saturday Night Live cast member who lives with borderline personality disorder and suicidal thoughts — he shared with Self:

I’ve spoken about BPD and being suicidal publicly only in the hopes that it will help bring awareness and help kids like myself who don’t want to be on this earth.

Davidson later appears on “A Message From the Count,” a playful interlude on Hotel Diablo.

referents.fragment: This shit ugly, I was just with Nipsey, now he ghost

range.content: This shit ugly, I was just with Nipsey, now he ghost

annotatable.link_title: Glass House by Machine Gun Kelly (Ft. Naomi Wild)
annotatable.title: Glass House

body.html:
Nipsey Hussle was a rapper, entrepreneur, and community activist who was fatally shot outside his clothing store in March 2019. MGK was initially going to release “Hollywood Whore” that week, but pushed it back out of respect for Hussle.

Before Hotel Diablo came out, MGK sporadically teased fans with song snippets. He posted a clip of “Glass House” before Hussle’s death, in which this lyric was:

I’m like Stevie, I can’t see these folks

Stevie Wonder is a blind American musician known for hits like “Isn’t She Lovely.”
body.plain:
Nipsey Hussle was a rapper, entrepreneur, and community activist who was fatally shot outside his clothing store in March 2019. MGK was initially going to release “Hollywood Whore” that week, but pushed it back out of respect for Hussle.



Before Hotel Diablo came out, MGK sporadically teased fans with song snippets. He posted a clip of “Glass House” before Hussle’s death, in which this lyric was:

I’m like Stevie, I can’t see these folks

Stevie Wonder is a blind American musician known for hits like “Isn’t She Lovely.”
